delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_RSSI_REPORT_TYPE: Report wireless client RSSI values for associated and/or unassociated clients..
x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_FEATURE_CONTROL: Alias to Enable or Disable feature
x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_DNS_RESOLVER: List of IPv4 & IPv6 DNS servers used for name resolution.
x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_VC_COUNTRY_CODE: Country code for the virtual controller.
x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_VC_IP: IP address for the virtual controller.
x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_VC_IPV6: IPv6 address for the virtual controller.
x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_ALLOW_NEW_APS: Allows the new access points to join the AP cluster.
x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_VLAN_VOICE_ENABLE: Alias to set Vlan type to voice
x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_IPV4_ADDRESSES_WITH_VRF: IPv4 Addresses in format X.X.X.X with VRF
x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_IPV6_ADDRESSES: IPv6 Address leaf list in format X:X::X:X
x-enumDescriptions.ALIAS_VLAN_ACTIVE_GATEWAY: Alias for interface vlan active gateway

hostname.description: The hostname is used as a default prompt. The alias name must be 'sys_host_name'.

items.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
items.description: List of VLAN ranges under vlan name

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

vlan-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

prefix.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).

An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
Dynamic client type to obtain IPv4 address.

ipv6-addresses.description: List of IPv6 addresses, static or dynamic.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).

x-enumDescriptions.DHCP_FULL: Obtain IPv6 address & Configuration information from DHCPv6 server.
x-enumDescriptions.DHCP_FULL_RAPID_COMMIT: Obtain IPv6 address quickly from DHCPv6 server.

oneOf.x-typeDescription: Dynamic client type to obtain IPv6 address.

address.description: The IPv6 address, static or dynamic.

eui64.description:
IPv6 address in the EUI-64 bit format.
This config cannot be set when IPv6 DHCP client is enabled.

ipv6-link-local-address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

report-rssi-type-value.description:
Set which client RSSI data will be reported to Central.
Two options: UNASSOCIATED_CLIENTS_ONLY and UNASSOCIATED_AND_ASSOCIATED_CLIENTS.

x-enumDescriptions.UNASSOCIATED_CLIENTS_ONLY: Only unassociated clients will be reported.
x-enumDescriptions.UNASSOCIATED_AND_ASSOCIATED_CLIENTS: Both associated and unassociated clients will be reported.

type.x-typeDescription:
It defines different types of client, that will be involved in
RSSI (Received Signal Strength Indicator) report.
type.description:
Set which client RSSI data will be reported to Central.
Two options: UNASSOCIATED_CLIENTS_ONLY and UNASSOCIATED_AND_ASSOCIATED_CLIENTS.

address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

hop-address.x-typeDescription: Valid IPv4 address type for interface

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).
items.description: List of IPv4 addresses with netmask specified.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

The domain-name type represents a DNS domain name.
Fully quallified left to the models which utilize this type.

Internet domain names are only loosely specified.  Section
3.5 of RFC 1034 recommends a syntax (modified in Section
2.1 of RFC 1123).  The pattern above is intended to allow
for current practice in domain name use, and some possible
future expansion.  It is designed to hold various types of
domain names, including names used for A or AAAA records
(host names) and other records, such as SRV records.  Note
that Internet host names have a stricter syntax (described
in RFC 952) than the DNS recommendations in RFCs 1034 and
1123, and that systems that want to store host names in
schema nodes using the domain-name type are recommended to
adhere to this stricter standard to ensure interoperability.

The encoding of DNS names in the DNS protocol is limited
to 255 characters.  Since the encoding consists of labels
prefixed by a length bytes and there is a trailing NULL
byte, only 253 characters can appear in the textual dotted
notation.

Domain-name values use the US-ASCII encoding.  Their canonical
format uses lowercase US-ASCII characters.  Internationalized
domain names MUST be encoded in punycode as described in RFC
3492

address.description:
Supported server entries are FQDN,
IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

x-enumDescriptions.BURST: Transmission burst mode when the server(s) are reachable.
x-enumDescriptions.IBURST: Transmission burst mode when the server(s) are unreachable.

tx-mode.description: Packet transmission mode to select the burst functionality.

x-enumDescriptions.INITIAL:
Sends a burst of packets initially to
the server to synchronize time.
x-enumDescriptions.ALWAYS:
Sends a burst of packets to the server
to synchronize time.
x-enumDescriptions.SINGLE:
Sends a single packet to the server
to synchronize time.

burst.description:
Packet transmission mode when server(s) are reachable,
only valid when the transmission mode is set to BURST.

x-enumDescriptions.INITIAL:
Sends a burst of packets initially to
the server to synchronize time.
x-enumDescriptions.ALWAYS:
Sends a burst of packets to the server
to synchronize time.
x-enumDescriptions.SINGLE:
Sends a single packet to the server
to synchronize time.

iburst.description:
Packet transmission mode when server(s) are unreachable,
only valid when the transmission mode is set to iBURST.

key-identifier.description:
Link authentication key identifier to server entry.
Ensure corresponding authentication key entry with identifier
exist.

min-poll.description:
Minimum poll interval in 2^n seconds, must be less than maximum
poll interval.

mgmt-interface.description: Management interface used by client to connect to the server.

prefer.description: The primary server preference for the client association.

version.description: Protocol version used by the client.

ntp-auth-global-value.description: Enable/disable NTP authentication feature alias value.

authenticate.description:
Enable authentication on outgoing packets generated by
client to the server.

key-identifier.description:
Authentication key identifier, must specify
key hashing algorithm and value.

key-value.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.

dns-resolver-value.description:
List of DNS servers used for name resolution functionality.
Both Ipv4 and IPv6 servers can be configured

resolver.description: List of DNS servers used for name resolution

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.

name-server.description: List of IPv4 & IPv6 DNS servers used for name resolution.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

ip.description: DNS server IP address to be used by resolver.

vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

management-interface.description: Name server for Out-of-band Management (OOBM) interface

description.description: Limit on description length for AP,GW:32 and for CX:64 characters.

vc-country-code-value.description: Defines the country code alias value.

country-code.description: Defines the country of operation of an AP.

vc-name-value.description: Defines virtual controller name alias value.

virtual-controller-name.description: Defines a unique name for the virtual controller.

vc-ip-value.description: Defines virtual controller ip address alias value.

virtual-controller-ip.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
virtual-controller-ip.description: Assigns an IP address for the virtual controller.

vc-ipv6-value.description: Defines virtual controller ipv6 address alias value.

virtual-controller-ipv6.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
virtual-controller-ipv6.description: Assigns an IPv6 address for the virtual controller.

vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
vlan.description: Associates a VLAN ID with the virtual controller.

mask.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
mask.description: Configures a subnet mask for the virtual controller.

gateway.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
gateway.description: Configures a gateway for the virtual controller.

vc-dnsip-value.description: Defines virtual controller ipv6 address alias value.

virtual-controller-dnsip.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
virtual-controller-dnsip.description: Configures the DNS IP address for the virtual controller.

allow-new-aps-value.description: Defines virtual controller ipv6 address alias value.

allow-new-aps.description: Allows the new access points to join the AP cluster.

voice-enable-value.description: Defines voice-enable alias value for the VLAN.

voice-enable.description: Assigns voice-enable value to the VLAN.

ip-vrf.description: Key combination of ip and vrf separated by ~

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.
items.description: List of IPv6 addresses in format X:X::X:X

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

gw-switchport-value.description: Defines switchport configuration alias value for gw-port-profile.

switchport.description: Switchport configuration. This configuration is valid only on a layer2 interface.

interface-mode.description:
Interface access or trunk mode for VLANs.
The access-vlan should be set to null for configuring trunk mode and
native-vlan and trunk-vlan-ranges should be set to null while configuring access mode
Eg: switchport: {interface-mode: ACCESS, access-vlan: 600, native-vlan: null,
trunk-vlan-ranges: null}
switchport: {interface-mode: TRUNK, access-vlan: null, native-vlan: NATIVE_VLAN,
trunk-vlan-ranges: [ 1000 ]}

native-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
native-vlan.description:
Native VLAN id for untagged frames arriving on
a trunk interface.  Tagged frames sent on an interface
configured with a native VLAN should have their tags
stripped prior to transmission. This configuration is only
valid on a trunk interface.

access-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
access-vlan.description: Assign the access VLAN to the access port.

items.x-typeDescription:
VLANs or only single-tagged VLANs or both. A range is
specified as x-y where x and y are valid VLAN IDs
(1 <= vlan-id <= 4094). The range is assumed to be inclusive,
such that any VLAN-ID matching x <= VLAN-ID <= y falls within
the range.
items.description: VLAN ranges that the interface may carry when in trunk mode.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).
